1. If involved in an accident, drivers should:
column4: avoid standing or walking in traffic lanes.
column6: stop their vehicle at or near the scene.
column8: turn off the ignitions of wrecked vehicles.

column2: 2. When parking down hill, the front wheels should be:
column6: turned toward the curb or shoulder.

column2: 3. A red traffic sign means?
4. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
5. Do not pass:
column6: when school bus lights are flashing.

column2: 6. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column6: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 7. This sign means drivers must not pass other vehicles:
column10: unless it is safe to do so.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: This street is reserved for trucks

column2: 9. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column6: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column8: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column10: accelerate to the speed of traffic.

column2: 10. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column10: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 14. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

16. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
17. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column6: yield the right-of way to all vehicles that arrive after you.
column8: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.
column10: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.

column2: 18. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: drive a few MPH faster than most.
column8: drive a few MPH slower than most.

20. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.

column2: 21. The picture shows a _________ sign.
22. Two solid yellow lines between lanes of traffic means:
column4: the lanes are designed to carry traffic in one direction at certain times and in the opposite direction at other times.
column6: passing is permitted on the left.

column2: 23. Roads are most slippery during the first rain.
24. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
